Dating: NAQADA II (not before); NAQADA; NAQADA III (not after)
Name: Cosmetic palette in the form of a perch
Description: This cosmetic palette in schist dates from the Naqada II-III Period and takes the form of a fish. The eye, the mouth and several anatomical details are finely carved in the hard stone. It is a perch, that is to say af "Lates Niloticus", sacred animal of the town of Esna (Latopolis).
